title: Pep Guardiola interview: Manchester City's boss on why results are secondary and feeling worse when they are WINNING
text:
Share this video Watch Next 
"Manchester City is three years or maybe longer, but I am still approaching the end of my career as a manager. I’m pretty sure of that. 
“If you’re looking for me, you will find me on the golf course. I will be there. There will be no wind, no rain.” Pep on... learning to lose 
“That means absolutely everything. When you win you are so happy but you are less worried and more concerned about how beautiful things were and what people say about you. 
“But when you lose, you are really worried that it doesn’t work and analyse what you have to do to get it better. Despair for Guardiola as City lose to Liverpool on New Year's Eve (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
“Sometimes, losing in special moments it's so important, to say, Guys, this is where we are.' Otherwise the victories only bring confusion — a lot of happiness but a lot of confusion. 
“I have more tension when we are winning. When we are 2-0 up I am more aggressive. 
"When we are losing I try to be more calm to work out what we have to do. Normally when you are winning, people relax – and you cannot relax in the 90 minutes. That’s why I’m more energetic.” Pep on... loving football 
“When I’m talking about the passion of football, on the pitch, it remains the same. But the business... football like this. 
"At the end of our job, 30% to 40% is football but the rest is off the pitch. It’s quite different from when I was a child.
